intro: Coniandra thunbergii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows up to 30 cm in height, with dark green, velvety leaves that are often used in traditional medicine. Its flowers, which come in shades of purple, pink, and white, bloom throughout the year in suitable conditions. Coniandra thunbergii is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
